intro: Cryptocoryne longispatha, commonly known as the long-spurred cryptocoryne, is a species of aquatic plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, white flowers with long spurs, which are adapted for pollination by specific insects. It thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments with moderate to high light levels. Cryptocoryne longispatha is often cultivated in aquariums due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
